alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 1:56AM PDT until April 20 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt including Palisade, elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Palisade. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, This is monitoring stage. No flooding occurs. This is about 2600 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:10 AM PDT Monday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.2 feet late this afternoon. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM PDT.
